name: Stacey D. POWELL, Petitioner v. EMIGRANT MORTGAGE COMPANY, INC., Respondent

parties: Stacey D. POWELL, Petitioner v. EMIGRANT MORTGAGE COMPANY, INC., Respondent.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
AND NOW, this 3rd day of February, 2010, the Petition for Allowance of Appeal is GRANTED, limited to the following question, as stated by Petitioner:
Did the Superior Court misapply Pennsylvania law in holding that a mortgage lender’s interest in property subject to a lis pendens, due to pending litigation involving title to the property, is controlled by the outcome of that litigation?
Allocatur is DENIED as to all remaining issues.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

casebody.head_matter:
988 A.2d 1288
Stacey D. POWELL, Petitioner v. EMIGRANT MORTGAGE COMPANY, INC., Respondent.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Feb. 3, 2010.
